alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 4:21AM PST until February 25 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 10 inches, except 10 to 20 inches above 7000 feet near and west of Highway 89. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph along Sierra ridgelines with gusts up to 35 mph in the Tahoe Basin. Waves 2 to 4 feet on Lake Tahoe. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 16 inches. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph along Sierra ridgelines. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon today to 4 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 AM PST Friday through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, including the morning and evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There may be big differences in snow totals over short distances due to the showery nature of the storm today through Thursday. Showers will be most prevalent in the afternoon hours today and again midday Thursday through Thursday night, with snow becoming steady Friday morning.
info.instruction: If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
